answers.answer: Doesn't sound like any reason for concern. Some babies are just small or he could be 8# and the docs estimate was wrong! My niece and nephew were both past 40 weeks and less than 6# both are totally healthy
He might just be 6 pounds when born or he might have a growth spurt! But if the doctors not worried you shouldnt be either

Thank you for your comments probs just me worrying too much my sister had a 6lb 11oz baby and she's smaller than me he's really active tho which gives me peace of mind :) just getting nervous now for the big day as its such a waiting game
Well least you wont have to push out a big baby :P

Hey remember the growth scans etc are an estimate!  They induced me with gestational diabetes and predicted my daughter would be big. She was only 6lb 6 and a half ounces. That is still on the small side of average so don't worry! I was 5lb 12 at birth and my brother was 5lb 3 and we were ALL healthy! My daughter is healthy, advanced and very clever. She had an infection when born but nothing to do with her size.. so even 6lb isn't considered underweight, plus the last few weeks they really pack the weight on, sounds like you have nothing to worry about so relax :)! x

Lol I suppose that's one positive things about it I'm trying to go for a water birth but have a feeling I'll be in soo much pain that I'll end up with the epi I don't cope we'll with pain I throw up and when I was in school I passed out because of pain from a period lol so this is going to be alot worse
Thank you I was 6lb 8 so hopefully he should put on the weight in the next few weeks plus my partner was exactly the same weight as me hopefully he will en up the same as us :)

Honestly, your baby will be a healthy size, you don't have to worry about it.! :) I know how worrying it can be as I've had growth scans both pregnancies because of gestational diabetes, one minute too small, then too big, pregnancy is an anxious time, we just want our babies to be healthy. And don't worry. I am rubbish with pain. My mother even lovingly said "Oh god how are you going to cope in labour.. you're really gonna have a rough time, you're rubbish with pain" and then after I had my daughter she was amazed watching me go through it.. I coped up until 7cm without an epidural, and then didn't get it topped up so I could feel for pushing. The shock on her face was great haha. She said I coped really well that she ate her words. :) You'll be fine, honestly, your instincts take over and you just get on with it.

Well a couple of weeks back I was preparing myself for a c-section as I had a low placenta but it's moved but still low they havnt booked me for anymore scans but do you think that there's any chance of it going back lower again they said he's head down and it's under his chin but to the side of him and said everything's ok now but could it move again?
I'm not sure lovely but you can always phone your doc and ask, but i'm sure if they were worried they would've told you. :)

Lol rach! My Dad was the same way xD. I was terrified of giving birth again after the nightmare with my daughter (I felt EVERYTHING because hospital staff didnt listen when I said Id need a stronger dose than normal for the epidural - I have a fast acting liver, if ya dont get me hard the first time nothing works). But when I was laying in bed watching tv with my second my Dad was cringing watching the contractions go off the scale and he looked at me with wide eyes going "Now thats some good pain killers!" I was like "What? What pain killers? They arent giving me anything til before breaking the water..." He about fell out of his chair lol
Haha it's a great feeling proving people wrong! ;) I was like hahah!

question: When I went for a 30 week scan they said my lil mans estimated Weight was 2lbs 13oz and went for my 36 week scan last week and he was 4lb 11oz he's only put on under 2 lb in those six weeks so bit worried that he's not going to be any bigger when he comes out and will have to stay in has anyone else had this? They said that he's really active which is good and that my body can't hold a big baby
title: Little worried my lil man will be really small
